author: Jean-Pierre Declemy
content:
Ramsgate in Kent, England has a tidal ball to indicate when there is enough water for vessels to enter the inner (locked) harbour. It is a sort of wicker affair on a mast near the Yacht Club.
I suspect that it is no longer hoisted or dropped because the harbour is run by the penny-pinching town council. I may be wrong.
The nearest Time Ball was at Deal, just to the south.

author: Peter Wright
content:
There is one on Carlton Hill in Edinburgh which slowly rises then drops on the 0ne oclock time signal. It was connected by electronic cable to a cannon that fired simultaneously at Edinburgh Castle. I have seen time contour maps showing the time delay in circles from the canon, this was used to sell accurate time around the city.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nelson_Monument,_Edinburgh
